subject: Bobsledding
lead_paragraph: The American Todd Hays’s hopes of competing in one more Olympics got a boost when he officially returned to national-level sliding by winning the drivers’ competition at the United States Bobsled Push Championships in Calgary, Alberta. Hays was the 2002 Olympic silver medalist but retired after failing to reach the medal podium at the 2006 Turin Games in Italy. Hays, already a three-time Olympian, announced late last year that he was making a comeback attempt.
